code fellows 102

## Read: 07 - Programming with JavaScript

### Control Flow

__*Control Flow*__ is the order of how a computer runs statements in a script. This is done from top to bottom, first line to the last.

### Functions

__*Functions*__ or *function statements* is a line of code that preforms a set of actions like in a procedure. It takes an input and provides an output.
These are its parts; a function keyword, followed by:

-The name of the function.
-A list of parameters to the function, enclosed in parentheses and separated by commas.
-The JavaScript statements that define the function, enclosed in curly brackets, {...}.

![Image of JS function](data:image/png;base64,)

### Expressions and Operators

An *operator* is when you have the program run and process data for an output. For example math problems. You input the numbers and the code will process the answer.

A *Function* is how operators find the output to your inputs. It is like the math problem itself: x + y = ans.

### Helpfull Links:

* [Explaining Functions](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Guide/Functions)
* [Function Examples](https://www.w3schools.com/js/js_functions.asp)
* [Explaining Expressions & Operators](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Guide/Expressions_and_Operators)
* [Operator Examples](https://www.w3schools.com/js/js_operators.asp)
